metadata.synopsis: Windmill mindflayer asks player to bring it a corpse to feed on.Speaker 3 is an optional non-illithid player that will briefly be pointed out as potential food in the conversation.

13.speaker: Mind Flayer
13.text: You have done me a service and received appropriate thanks.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Before you lies the unconscious body of a mind flayer, glistening and raw.*

62.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
62.text: Oh but it is. This one has only just transformed. It is weak, vulnerable - its potential ripe for harvesting.

96.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
96.text: Go on. Kill it. Absorb its power.

114.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sleeping mind flayer wakes up and stands up

77.speaker: Mind Flayer
77.context: NodeContext: Saying "come no closer, you wretch!" but stalls on 'you' because it realises you're not what it thought you were

37.speaker: Mind Flayer
37.text: ...what are you? What am I sensing?

113.speaker: Mind Flayer
113.text: Ah, the trace of illithid power. There is none in your body, but you have been close to it. Touched by it.

33.speaker: Mind Flayer
33.text: You are an ally of my people. A servant, perhaps?

72.speaker: Mind Flayer
72.text: I require an equal: one with the same power flowing through their form.

17.speaker: Mind Flayer
17.text: Return with the one you follow - I will speak to them and no other.

89.speaker: Mind Flayer
89.text: Call it what you will - we are all threads in the fabric of the Grand Design.

27.speaker: Mind Flayer
27.text: But I require an equal. Return with the one you follow. I shall speak with them.

84.speaker: Mind Flayer
84.text: Insolent lackey! You will be my very first meal.

25.speaker: Mind Flayer
25.text: Ah, you again. I have all I need, I require neither your services nor your master's.

35.speaker: Mind Flayer
35.text: You are like me - like I was - a vessel, yet to transform.

24.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
24.text: This one is newly changed. Its body is weak, its potential ripe for harvesting.

53.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
53.text: Go on. Kill it. Absorb its power.

76.speaker: Mind Flayer
76.text: Help me. I am so hungry.

97.speaker: Mind Flayer
97.text: We are new to our collective. Our - my birth was difficult. The vessel fought hard. It left me weak.

115.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
115.text: A newborn. Vulnerable, its potential ripe for harvesting.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Was it you I heard screaming when I entered the windmill?

39.speaker: Mind Flayer
39.text: My vessel. He fought the transformation - he found it excoriating.

22.speaker: Mind Flayer
22.text: I can still taste his terror. It is delicious, but will not sustain me.

68.speaker: Mind Flayer
68.text: We need to feed. We need a brain, fresh and frantic, to restore our strength.

101.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
101.text: Go on. Kill it. Absorb its power.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I'll see what I can do.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I can fetch you a corpse, freshly killed. Brain intact.

80.speaker: Mind Flayer
80.text: I shall be here, waiting for your return.

52.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
52.text: Curtail your sympathy. We wish to destroy the elder brain, not nourish its thralls.

14.speaker: Mind Flayer
14.text: I sense you are under-developed. Bring me a brain and I will help you augment yourself.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Offer the mind flayer the body you're carrying.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Go find your own meal! Even weakened you're more powerful than anything out there.

57.speaker: Mind Flayer
57.text: You are correct. I am ready.
57.context: NodeContext: Starting to believe in itself.

20.speaker: Mind Flayer
20.text: I cannot risk this body. I have heard the call - we will all be needed for what is to come.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm not going to bring you food.

21.speaker: Mind Flayer
21.text: Very well, kin, I shall dine on you.

32.speaker: Mind Flayer
32.text: You would betray us? Then you shall be our very first meal.

88.speaker: Mind Flayer
88.text: Be swift kin. I need your aid.

67.speaker: Mind Flayer
67.text: You return. You look stronger as I grow only weaker.

64.speaker: Mind Flayer
64.text: Will you help me? I am still weak after my transformation. Still hungry.

104.speaker: Mind Flayer
104.text: So loud... Why are you - you...
104.context: NodeContext: saying "why are you shouting" but stalls on the "you" as it realised the player is something different, strange

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Attack the creature before it wakes up.

112.speaker: Mind Flayer
112.text: What? No - I've had so little time!

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *You pick your way silently through the loose rocks and broken masonry until you're a safe distance away.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *You try to pick your way silently through the loose rocks and broken masonry, but to no avail.*

73.speaker: Mind Flayer
73.text: Who is there? Who shall be my first meal?

44.speaker: Mind Flayer
44.text: You return. Will you aid me?

60.speaker: Mind Flayer
60.text: You approach me again. And again I tell you, I require someone blessed with an illithid passenger.

47.speaker: Mind Flayer
47.text: But no matter, I desire solitude. Leave me.

117.speaker: Mind Flayer
117.text: You have returned. With a meal, I hope.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Offer the mind flayer the body you're carrying.

116.speaker: Mind Flayer
116.text: And as you have aided me, so I shall aid you.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *You feel its presence gently probing the palace of your mind. As it finds a mostly-vacant spot, power and knowledge flood your brain, unlocking a new secret.*

107.speaker: Mind Flayer
107.text: Take this. I have no use for such baubles now. It may aid you.

2.speaker: Mind Flayer
2.text: Now leave. I will feed alone.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Not yet - I just need a little more time.

16.speaker: Mind Flayer
16.text: Be quick. Time is on no one's side.
